intro: Impatiens gardneriana, commonly known as the Mexican impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features showy, funnel-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, with five petals and a prominent spur. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Impatiens gardneriana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
